intro: Uragoga nyassana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that can be either upright or trailing. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental horticulture. Uragoga nyassana prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
